entry.title: How to fight a pandemic of misinformation? | Inside Story

media:group.media:title: How to fight a pandemic of misinformation? | Inside Story
media:group.media:description:
The coronavirus pandemic has forced us all to take a step back from our daily routines. We now spend more time at home, working remotely and relying on the internet for the latest updates. But there's also been an unprecedented rise in misinformation. Conspiracy theories have even led to injuries and deaths as people believe false and dangerous rumours posing as medical advice. And discrimination, stigmatization, racism and hate speech have also increased because of these campaigns So, how do we fight this? And is some of the misinformation being put out deliberately?
Presenter: Folly Bah Thibault
Guests:
Guy Berger - Director of Freedom of Expression and Media Development at UNESCO.
Dr. Hanan Abdul Rahim - Dean of the College of Health Sciences at Qatar University.
Omar Suleiman - Founder and President of the Yaqeen Institute for Islamic Research.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: Kenya fears ecological disaster as two rising lakes get closer

media:group.media:title: Kenya fears ecological disaster as two rising lakes get closer
media:group.media:description:
Rising water levels along Kenya's Great Rift Valley have forced thousands of people from their homes. There are also fears of an ecological disaster as two lakes are getting closer - causing fear of contamination, and threatening wildlife and livelihoods. Al Jazeera's Catherine Soi explains.

entry.title: Belarus activists seek refuge abroad amid political crisis

media:group.media:title: Belarus activists seek refuge abroad amid political crisis
media:group.media:description:
Several Baltic states have imposed travel bans on senior Belarusian figures, including President Alexander Lukashenko. The move comes after more than three weeks of protests against Lukashenko's declaration that he won 80 percent of the vote in the last presidential election. Meanwhile, thousands of people continue to demonstrate against the president, and many have had to seek refuge in neighbouring countries. Al Jazeera's Bernard Smith reports from the Lithuanian capital, Vilnius.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #Belarus

entry.title: üá∑üá∫ Is the Russian opposition finished? | The Stream

media:group.media:title: üá∑üá∫ Is the Russian opposition finished? | The Stream
media:group.media:description:
Russia‚Äôs main opposition figure Alexei Navalny remains gravely ill after what his supporters say was a poisoning recently ordered by the Kremlin.
Navalny, who rose to prominence in 2008 when he began to publicly accuse the Kremlin of widespread corruption, has called President Vladimir Putin's United Russia party one of "crooks and thieves." Navalny was banned from running in the 2018 presidential election over accusations of embezzlement ‚Äì a claim rejected by Navalny and rights groups.
In this episode of The Stream we ask, how viable is a Russian opposition? What motivation is there for Russians to join an opposition movement? And, in a self-declared democracy, can more challengers to Putin emerge?
#Aljazeeraenglish #News #russia #navalny #putin

entry.title: Lebanon appoints Mustapha Adib as new PM

media:group.media:title: Lebanon appoints Mustapha Adib as new PM
media:group.media:description:
Mustapha Adib has been named as prime minister-designate and will now form a new government. The former ambassador to Germany won support from several parties, including the Future Movement and the Shia bloc, Hezbollah. Al Jazeera's Zeina Khodr has the latest from Beirut.

entry.title: Police fire pellet guns on Kashmir Muharram procession: Witnesses

media:group.media:title: Police fire pellet guns on Kashmir Muharram procession: Witnesses
media:group.media:description:
Dozens of people have been injured after security forces in Indian-administered Kashmir fired on a Muharram procession.
Shia Muslims were taking part in the religious procession, which had been banned this year by the Indian authorities.
Al Jazeera‚Äôs Victoria Gatenby reports.

entry.title: üá∫üá∏ US 2020: will the election truly reflect the people's choice?

media:group.media:title: üá∫üá∏ US 2020: will the election truly reflect the people's choice?
media:group.media:description:
There are less than 10 weeks before one of the most consequential US presidential and congressional elections in decades, but concerns are rising over whether people's voices will be truly reflected through the ballot box.
Partisan battles over mail-in voting, the impact of coronavirus, and the effect of contentious redistricting practices are just some of the issues that may determine whether Donald Trump or Joe Biden is elected US president.
The Stream meets three experts on US elections and voting to hear their thoughts in the run-up to November 3.
Join the conversation: TWITTER: https://twitter.com/AJStream FACEBOOK: http://www.facebook.com/AJStream Subscribe to our channel http://bit.ly/AJSubscribe
#Aljazeeraenglish #News #trump #biden #USelection2020

entry.title: Australia warned of 'more frequent and intense' natural disasters

media:group.media:title: Australia warned of 'more frequent and intense' natural disasters
media:group.media:description:
Australia's bushfire commission has warned the government to be prepared for "more frequent and intense" natural disasters in the coming years. The commission released its first report on summer bushfires that burned through millions of hectares of land. Al Jazeera's Nicola Gage visited the community of Broulee near the capital Canberra to see how recovery efforts are going.

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: Lebanon establishment tasks Mustapha Adib with forming new gov't

media:group.media:title: Lebanon establishment tasks Mustapha Adib with forming new gov't
media:group.media:description:
Lebanese diplomat Mustapha Adib has been tasked with forming a government by an overwhelming majority of parliamentarians representing the country's political establishment. Adib received the votes of 90 MPs out of a possible 120, garnering the support of Hezbollah and its allies the Free Patriotic Movement and the Amal Movement, in addition to the Future Movement of former prime minister Saad Hariri and a number of smaller blocs.

entry.title: Sceptics wary of Hong Kong COVID testing programme China funded

media:group.media:title: Sceptics wary of Hong Kong COVID testing programme China funded
media:group.media:description:
Hong Kong's government says 500,000 people have already signed up for its free universal coronavirus testing program, which is due to launch on Tuesday. But a pro-democracy union of healthcare workers has called for a boycott because the plan is being funded by the Chinese government. A team of medical staff from China will lead the screening, and three mainland-based laboratories will process the results, leading many to fear that genetic data collected could be used for other purposes.
Al Jazeera‚Äôs Sarah Clarke reports from Hong Kong.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#HongKong #COVID19 #UniversalTesting

entry.title: Sudan signs peace deal with rebel groups

media:group.media:title: Sudan signs peace deal with rebel groups
media:group.media:description:
Sudan's government and rebel groups agreed on a peace deal on Monday to end 17 years of conflict. The Sudan Revolutionary Front (SRF), a coalition of rebel groups from the western region of Darfur and the southern states of South Kordofan and Blue Nile, signed the peace agreement at a ceremony in Juba, capital of neighbouring South Sudan, which has hosted and helped mediate the long-running talks since late 2019.
Al Jazeera‚Äôs Heba Morgan reports from Khartoum.

entry.title: COVID-19 in Latin America: Medic protest work conditions

media:group.media:title: COVID-19 in Latin America: Medic protest work conditions
media:group.media:description:
Countries in Latin America are still struggling to bring the coronavirus pandemic under control, with the number of cases and deaths still rising. Medical workers across Latin America are protesting a lack of personal protective equipment, demanding better working conditions and pay as COVID-19 infections spread among them. The region accounts for about a third of the more than 25 million global infections.
Al Jazeera‚Äôs Daniel Schweimler reports from Buenos Aires, Argentina.

#LatinAmerica #Coranavirus #PPE

entry.title: Who are the Kurds? | Start Here

media:group.media:title: Who are the Kurds? | Start Here
media:group.media:description:
The fight against ISIL in Syria, an uneasy US alliance and being considered a terrorist organisation by a number of countries have kept the Kurdish people in the news. So who are the Kurds? And why is there so much resistance to creating a Kurdish nation state? Start Here explores the history of a people looking for a home and why the struggle for independence has pushed some to pick up arms.

entry.title: Portland protests: Mayor blames Trump after shooting

media:group.media:title: Portland protests: Mayor blames Trump after shooting
media:group.media:description:
The mayor of Portland has accused President Donald Trump of creating a culture of fear, hate and division in the US. The criticism comes after a supporter of a far-right group was killed on Saturday night. It happened when backers of the president clashed with counterdemonstrators.
Al Jazeera‚Äôs Mike Hanna reports from the US capital, Washington, DC.
